title: Political party affiliation and being vocal

content.prompt: Carla wants to investigate whether a personâ€™s political party affiliation causes the person to be more vocal about political issues. She plans to administer a survey to a large sample of people. Which of the following describes why the method of data collection used will prevent Carla from achieving her goal?

choices.label: Surveys are not a valid method of collecting data.
Causation cannot be determined from a survey.
Political opinions are less likely to be voiced on a survey.
Carla needs to administer the survey to the entire population to determine causation.
Some surveys might not be returned, which could result in bias.

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Make an appropriate claim or draw an appropriate conclusion.
